Identification.LongTitle: An Act to provide for the payment of superannuation benefits to Lieutenant Governors

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the Lieutenant Governors Superannuation Act.

Definition.Text: contributor means a Lieutenant Governor who is required by subsection 4(1) to contribute to the Consolidated Revenue Fund and includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a Lieutenant Governor who has, pursuant to subsection 4(2), ceased to be required so to contribute, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a Lieutenant Governor who has ceased to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province and has become entitled to an immediate pension or a deferred pension under this Act;

Definition.Text: deferred pension means a pension that becomes payable to a person at the time he or she reaches sixty years of age;

disabled, with respect to a contributor, means afflicted with a permanent infirmity that renders the contributor incapable of performing the duties and functions of his office or incapable of pursuing regularly any substantially gainful occupation commensurate with his qualifications;
immediate pension means a pension that becomes payable to a person immediately on his becoming entitled thereto;
Lieutenant Governor means a person who holds office as the lieutenant governor of a province on or after December 2, 1975;

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person who was married

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to a Lieutenant Governor or former Lieutenant Governor immediately before the death of the Lieutenant Governor or former Lieutenant Governor, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a former Lieutenant Governor, to him or her immediately before the time when he or she ceased to be a Lieutenant Governor; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person who establishes that the person was cohabiting in a relationship of a conjugal nature

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: with a Lieutenant Governor or former Lieutenant Governor for at least one year immediately before the death of the Lieutenant Governor or former Lieutenant Governor, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a former Lieutenant Governor, with him or her immediately before he or she ceased to be a Lieutenant Governor.

Subsection.Text: Every contributor who has contributed under this Act in respect of five years of service as the lieutenant governor of a province is, subject to this Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: entitled on ceasing to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if he or she has reached the age of sixty years or is disabled, to an immediate pension calculated in accordance with subsection (2), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if he or she has not reached the age of sixty years, subject to subsection (3), to

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a deferred pension, calculated in accordance with subsection (2), or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a return of the total contributions made by him or her under this Part, together with interest, if any, calculated pursuant to subsection (5),

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: at his or her option; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: entitled, if he or she becomes disabled not having reached sixty years of age but having become entitled to a deferred pension, to an immediate pension calculated in accordance with subsection (2), in which case he or she ceases to be entitled to a deferred pension referred to in clause (a)(ii)(A).

Subsection.Text: Subject to this Act, the pension to which a contributor is entitled under this section is three-tenths of the average salary received by him during the last five years of his service as the lieutenant governor of a province.

Where under subsection (1) a contributor is entitled to a deferred pension or a return of contributions at his option and he fails to exercise the option within six months from the day on which he ceases to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province, he shall be deemed to have exercised the option in favour of a deferred pension.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Return of contributions to Lieutenant Governor on ceasing to hold office
Subsection.Text: Every contributor who, on ceasing to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province, is not entitled to a pension under subsection (1) is entitled, on ceasing to hold that office, to a return of the total contributions made by him under this Part, together with interest, if any, calculated pursuant to subsection (5).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Interest on payment and amount of contributions
Subsection.Text: When, at any time after December 31, 1975, a contributor or his or her survivor, estate or succession becomes entitled, pursuant to subsection (1) or (4) or section 8 or 9, to be paid any amount of the contributions made by the contributor under this Part, the President of the Treasury Board shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: determine the total amount of contributions that have been made under this Part by the contributor during each year, in this subsection called a "contribution year", in which contributions were made by the contributor; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: calculate interest at the rate of four per cent compounded annually on the aggregate amount in respect of each contribution year from December 31 of that year to December 31 of the year immediately preceding the year in which the contributor ceased to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province.

Subsection.Text: Every Lieutenant Governor shall, by reservation from his salary, contribute to the Consolidated Revenue Fund six per cent of his salary.

Notwithstanding anything in this Part, no contributor shall contribute as required by subsection (1) after he has contributed under this Act in respect of service as the lieutenant governor of a province totalling five years.
For the purposes of the Income Tax Act, the amount contributed by a Lieutenant Governor pursuant to subsection (1) shall be deemed to be contributed to or under a registered pension plan.

Section.MarginalNote: Election not to contribute under section 4

Subsection.Text: A Lieutenant Governor may, in writing, elect, within six months after his appointment as the lieutenant governor of a province, not to contribute pursuant to section 4 and on so electing he shall, notwithstanding that section, not be required to contribute pursuant to that section.

A Lieutenant Governor who has made an election under this section and who has made any contributions pursuant to section 4 or 13 is entitled to a return of the total amount of those contributions, without interest.
An election made under this section is irrevocable.

Subsection.MarginalNote: When sections 3, 4, 7, 8 and 8.1 do not apply
Subsection.Text: Sections 3 and 4 do not apply to a Lieutenant Governor who has made an election under this section and sections 7, 8 and 8.1 do not apply to the survivor of a Lieutenant Governor who has made an election under this section.

Section.MarginalNote: Diversion to satisfy financial support order

Subsection.Text: When any court in Canada of competent jurisdiction has made an order requiring a former Lieutenant Governor to pay financial support, amounts payable to the former Lieutenant Governor under this Part are subject to being diverted to the person named in the order in accordance with Part II of the Garnishment, Attachment and Pension Diversion Act.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Payment deemed to be to pension recipient
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Part, any payment made pursuant to subsection (1) shall be deemed to have been made to the former lieutenant governor in respect of whom the payment was made.

Where a contributor who has ceased to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province but who is entitled to be paid an immediate pension or a deferred pension under section 3 dies, his surviving spouse, if that person was his spouse at the time he ceased to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province, shall be paid a pension equal to one-half of the immediate pension or deferred pension to which the contributor was entitled under that section.

Where a contributor who has, pursuant to subsection 4(2), ceased to be required to contribute pursuant to subsection 4(1) dies while holding office as the lieutenant governor of a province, his surviving spouse shall be paid a pension equal to one-half of the immediate pension or deferred pension to which the contributor would have become entitled under section 3 had he, immediately prior to his death, ceased, for any reason other than death, to hold office as the lieutenant governor of the province.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Commencement of pension to surviving spouse
Subsection.Text: A pension that is payable under this section to the surviving spouse of a contributor commences to be payable immediately after the death of the contributor.

Section.MarginalNote: Return of contributions to surviving spouse
Section.Text: Where a contributor dies while holding office as the lieutenant governor of a province and his surviving spouse is not entitled to a pension under section 7, his surviving spouse shall be paid the total amount of the contributions made by the contributor under this Part, together with interest, if any, calculated pursuant to subsection 3(5).

Subsection.Text: If the person to whom a former Lieutenant Governor is married or with whom he or she is cohabiting in a relationship of a conjugal nature, having so cohabited for a period of at least one year, would not be entitled to a pension under section 7 in the event of the former Lieutenant Governor’s death, the former Lieutenant Governor may make an election, in accordance with the regulations, to reduce the amount of the pension to which he or she is entitled in order that the person could become entitled to a pension under subsection (2).

A person referred to in subsection (1) is entitled to a pension in an amount determined in accordance with the election and the regulations if the former Lieutenant Governor dies and the election is not revoked or deemed to have been revoked, and the person was married to the former Lieutenant Governor at the time of his or her death, or was cohabiting with the former Lieutenant Governor in a relationship of a conjugal nature for a period of at least one year immediately before his or her death.

A person who is entitled to receive a pension under section 7 after the former Lieutenant Governor’s death is not entitled to a pension under subsection (2) in respect of that former Lieutenant Governor.

Section.Text: Where, on the death of a contributor, there is no surviving spouse to whom a pension or return of contributions under this Act may be paid, or where a person who is entitled to a pension under this Act as the surviving spouse of a contributor dies, any amount by which the total amount of the contributions made by the contributor under this Part, together with interest, if any, calculated pursuant to subsection 3(5), exceeds the total amount paid to the contributor and his surviving spouse under this Part shall be paid, as a death benefit, to his estate or, if less than one thousand dollars, as the President of the Treasury Board may direct.

Subsection.Text: The pensions and returns of contributions payable under this Act shall be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund.
Where a pension becomes payable under this Act, it shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be paid in equal monthly instalments in arrears;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subject to paragraph (c), be paid pro rata for any period of less than a month; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: continue, subject to this Act, during the lifetime of the recipient and thereafter until the end of the month in which the recipient dies.

Section.Text: The Governor in Council may make regulations

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the terms on which a contributor may pay for any period of service in instalments and the method of determining

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the amounts to be reserved from any amount payable to a contributor by Her Majesty in right of Canada, including any pension payable to him under this Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the amounts to be recovered from any pension payable to the survivor of a contributor under this Act

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the medical examination to be required to determine whether a contributor is disabled;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing forms for the purposes of this Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: respecting the election that may be made under section 8.1, including regulations respecting

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the time, manner and circumstances in which an election may be made, revoked or deemed to have been revoked;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the reduction to be made in the amount of a former Lieutenant Governor’s pension when an election is made;

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount of the pension to be paid under subsection 8.1(2); and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any other matter that the Governor in Council considers necessary for carrying out the purposes and provisions of section 8.1.

Section.Text: In this Part, Supplementary Retirement Benefits Account means the Account established in the accounts of Canada pursuant to the Supplementary Retirement Benefits Act.

Every contributor, except a contributor who has ceased to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province, is required to contribute to the Supplementary Retirement Benefits Account, by reservation from his salary,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prior to 1977, an amount equal to one-half of one per cent of his salary; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: commencing with the month of January, 1977, an amount equal to one per cent of his salary.

Section.Text: For the purposes of the Income Tax Act, the amount contributed by a contributor pursuant to section 13 shall be deemed to be contributed to or under a registered pension plan.

Section.MarginalNote: Amount to be credited to S.R.B. Account
Section.Text: Where any amount is paid into the Supplementary Retirement Benefits Account pursuant to section 13, an amount equal to the amount so paid shall be credited to that Account.

Subsection.Text: The definition disabled in section 2 of the Lieutenant Governors Superannuation Act is repealed.
The definition contributor in section 2 of the Act is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a Lieutenant Governor who is required by subsection 4(1) to contribute to the Consolidated Revenue Fund and includes

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a Lieutenant Governor who has ceased to be required to so contribute by reason of subsection 4(2), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a Lieutenant Governor who has ceased to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province and who has become entitled to an immediate pension or a deferred pension under this Act,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is required by subsection 4.1(3) to contribute to the Consolidated Revenue Fund, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is no longer required by subsection 4.1(3) to contribute to the Consolidated Revenue Fund by reason of the expiry of the period referred to in that subsection and who has, on the expiry of that period, become entitled to an immediate pension or a deferred pension under this Act; (contributeur)

Subsection.Text: Subparagraph (a)(ii) of the definition survivor in section 2 of the Act is replaced by the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a former Lieutenant Governor, to him or her immediately before the later of the day on which he or she ceased to be a Lieutenant Governor and the day on which he or she ceased to contribute under subsection 4.1(3), or

Subsection.Text: Subparagraph (b)(ii) of the definition survivor in section 2 of the Act is replaced by the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a former Lieutenant Governor, with him or her immediately before the later of the day on which he or she ceased to be a Lieutenant Governor and the day on which he or she ceased to contribute under subsection 4.1(3).

Subsection.Text: The portion of subsection 3(1) of the Act before subparagraph (a)(i) is replaced by the following:
Every contributor who has contributed under this Act for five consecutive years is, subject to this Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: entitled on the later of the day on which he or she ceases to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province and the day on which he or she ceases to contribute under subsection 4.1(3),

Subsection.Text: Subsections 3(2) to (4) of the Act are replaced by the following:
Subject to this Act, the pension to which a contributor is entitled under this section is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: three-tenths of the average salary received by him or her during the last five years of his or her service as the lieutenant governor of a province; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a contributor to whom section 4.1 applies, three-tenths of the average salary on which his or her contributions under this Act were based.

Subsection.Text: If under subsection (1) a contributor is entitled to a deferred pension or a return of contributions at his or her option and he or she fails to exercise the option within six months after the later of the day on which he or she ceases to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province and the day on which he or she ceased to contribute under subsection 4.1(3), he or she is deemed to have exercised the option in favour of a deferred pension.

Every contributor who, on the later of the day on which he or she ceases to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province and the day on which he or she ceases to contribute under subsection 4.1(3), is not entitled to a pension under subsection (1) is, on that later date, entitled to a return of the total contributions made by him or her under this Part, together with interest, if any, calculated under subsection (5).
Paragraph 3(5)(b) of the Act is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: calculate interest at the rate of four per cent compounded annually on the aggregate amount in respect of each contribution year from December 31 of that year to December 31 of the year immediately preceding the later of the year in which the contributor ceased to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province and the year in which the contributor ceased to contribute under subsection 4.1(3).

Subsection.Text: Section 3 of the Act is amended by adding the following after subsection (5):

In this section, disabled means afflicted with a permanent infirmity that renders the contributor incapable of performing the duties and functions of his or her office or incapable of pursuing regularly any substantially gainful occupation commensurate with his or her qualifications.

Section.Text: Subsection 4(3) of the Act is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of the Income Tax Act, the amount contributed under subsection (1) or 4.1(3) is deemed to be contributed to or under a registered pension plan.

Section.Text: The Act is amended by adding the following after section 4:

Section.MarginalNote: Contributor deemed to be lieutenant governor

Subsection.Text: A contributor who ceases to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province by reason of having become disabled is deemed, for the purposes of this Act, to remain a lieutenant governor of a province for the period referred to in subsection (2) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the time of ceasing to hold office, he or she had not contributed under this Act in respect of five years of service as the lieutenant governor of a province; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: he or she becomes entitled to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: long-term disability insurance benefits under the terms of the Public Service Management Insurance Plan, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a disability allowance under section 5 of the Salaries Act.

Subsection.Text: The contributor is deemed to remain a lieutenant governor of a province during the period that commences on the day on which he or she ceased to hold office by reason of having become disabled and ends on the earliest of the day

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on which he or she dies,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on which he or she ceases to be entitled to long-term disability insurance benefits under the terms of the Public Service Management Insurance Plan unless he or she immediately becomes entitled to a disability allowance under section 5 of the Salaries Act,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: on which he or she ceases to be entitled to a disability allowance under section 5 of the Salaries Act, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: that is five years after the day on which he or she commenced to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province.

Subsection.Text: During the period referred to in subsection (2), the contributor shall contribute to the Consolidated Revenue Fund six per cent of the salary that he or she would have been paid if he or she had remained a lieutenant governor of a province.
The contributions that the contributor is required to make under subsection (3) are to be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: remitted directly by the contributor on a monthly, quarterly, semi-annual or annual basis if he or she becomes entitled to long-term disability insurance benefits under the Public Service Management Insurance Plan; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: made by reservation from the disability allowance payable to him or her under section 5 of the Salaries Act.

Subsection.Text: Subsection 5(1) of the French version of the Act is replaced by the following:

Section.MarginalNote: Choix de ne pas contribuer sous le régime de l’article 4

Subsection.Text: Un lieutenant-gouverneur peut choisir, par écrit, dans les six mois qui suivent sa nomination à la charge de lieutenant-gouverneur d’une province, de ne pas contribuer sous le régime de l’article 4 et, s’il fait ce choix, il n’est pas tenu, malgré l’article 4, de contribuer sous le régime de cet article.
Subsection 5(4) of the Act is replaced by the following:

Sections 3 to 4.1 do not apply to a Lieutenant Governor who has made an election under this section and sections 7 and 8 do not apply to the survivor of a Lieutenant Governor who has made an election under this section.

Section.Text: The heading before section 7 and sections 7 to 9 of the Act are replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: If a contributor who has ceased to hold office as the lieutenant governor of a province, or who has ceased to contribute under subsection 4.1(3), but who is entitled to be paid an immediate pension or a deferred pension under section 3 dies, his or her survivor is to be paid a pension equal to one half of the immediate pension or deferred pension to which the contributor was entitled under that section.

If a contributor who has ceased to be required to contribute under subsection 4(1) by reason of subsection 4(2) dies while holding office as the lieutenant governor of a province, his or her survivor is to be paid a pension equal to one half of the immediate pension or deferred pension to which the contributor would have become entitled under section 3 had he or she, immediately prior to his or her death, ceased, for any reason other than death, to hold office as the lieutenant governor of the province.
If a pension is payable under subsection (1) or (2) and there are two survivors of the contributor, the total amount of the pension is to be apportioned so that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the survivor referred to in paragraph (a) of the definition survivor in section 2 receives an amount, if any, equal to the total amount less any amount determined under paragraph (b) of this subsection; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the survivor referred to in paragraph (b) of that definition receives an amount equal to that proportion of the total amount that the number of years that the survivor cohabited with the contributor while the contributor was a lieutenant governor of a province is of the number of years that the contributor was a lieutenant governor of a province.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (3)(b), the period during which a contributor contributed under subsection 4.1(3) is to be included in determining the number of years that he or she was a lieutenant governor of a province.
In determining a number of years for the purpose of paragraph (3)(b), a part of a year is to be counted as a full year if the part is six or more months and ignored if it is less.
A pension that is payable under this section to a survivor of a contributor commences to be payable immediately after the death of the contributor.

If a contributor dies while holding office as the lieutenant governor of a province or while being required to contribute under subsection 4.1(3) and his or her survivor is not entitled to a pension under section 7, his or her survivor is to be paid the total amount of the contributions made by the contributor under this Part, together with interest, if any, calculated under subsection 3(5).
If a return of contributions is payable under subsection (1) and there are two survivors of the contributor, the total amount of the return of contributions is to be apportioned so that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the survivor referred to in paragraph (a) of the definition survivor in section 2 receives an amount, if any, equal to the total amount less any amount determined under paragraph (b) of this subsection; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the survivor referred to in paragraph (b) of that definition receives an amount equal to that proportion of the total amount that the number of years that the survivor cohabited with the contributor while the contributor was a lieutenant governor of a province is of the number of years that the contributor was a lieutenant governor of a province.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (2)(b), the period during which a contributor contributed under subsection 4.1(3) is to be included in determining the number of years that he or she was a lieutenant governor of a province.
In determining a number of years for the purpose of paragraph (2)(b), a part of a year is to be counted as a full year if the part is six or more months and ignored if it is less.

Section.Text: If, on the death of a contributor, there is no survivor to whom a pension or return of contributions under this Act may be paid, or if the contributor’s survivor dies, any amount by which the total amount of the contributions made by the contributor under this Part, together with interest, if any, calculated under subsection 3(5), exceeds the total amount paid to the contributor and his or her survivor under this Part is to be paid, as a death benefit, to the contributor’s estate or succession or, if less than $1,000, as the President of the Treasury Board may direct.
Paragraph 11(b) of the Act is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the medical examination to be required to determine whether a contributor is disabled for the purposes of section 3; and

Section.Text: Section 13 of the Act is renumbered as subsection 13(1) and is amended by adding the following:

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), a person to whom subsection 4.1(1) applies is required, in respect of the period referred to in subsection 4.1(2), to contribute to the Supplementary Retirement Benefits Account one per cent of the salary that he or she would have been paid during that period if the person had continued to hold office as a lieutenant governor of a province.
The contributions that the contributor is required to make under subsection (2) are to be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: remitted directly by the contributor on a monthly, quarterly, semi-annual or annual basis if he or she becomes entitled to long-term disability insurance benefits under the Public Service Management Insurance Plan; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: made by reservation from the disability allowance payable to him or her under section 5 of the Salaries Act.

Section.Text: On the later of the coming into force of subsection 5(4) of the Lieutenant Governors Superannuation Act, as enacted by subsection 14(2) of this Act, and section 174 of the Modernization of Benefits and Obligations Act, as enacted by section 18 of this Act, subsection 5(4) of the Lieutenant Governors Superannuation Act is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: Sections 3 to 4.1 do not apply to a Lieutenant Governor who has made an election under this section and sections 7 to 8.1 do not apply to the survivor of a Lieutenant Governor who has made an election under this section.
